item.title: Current state of P2P research in Bitcoin /Erlay
item.description: London Bitcoin Devs https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1201861687097352198 Introduction My name is Gleb. I’ve worked on Bitcoin stuff since 2015, building wallets and exchanges in Ukraine. Then I realized that I can do more fun stuff. I want to do more protocol research, improving Bitcoin itself, not just using it. I decided I will go to Canada to do a Masters. I started working on this topic on research stuff more precisely and I realized that not many people do work on peer-to-peer (P2P) of Bitcoin.

item.title: Erlay
item.description: Erlay: Bandwidth-efficient transaction relay for bitcoin https://twitter.com/kanzure/status/1171744449396953090 paper: https://arxiv.org/abs/1905.10518 Introduction Hi, my name is Gleb. I work at Chaincode Labs. I am working on making nodes better and stronger and make the network more robust. I’ve been working on erlay with Pieter and Greg and some other guys. Bitcoin p2p network There are private nodes that are behind firewalls like ones run at home. If your node is connected to a router, your router tries to protect you from the internet accessing your endpoint.
